client Module¶

class Game.client.Client(ip_address, port, map_size, time)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(ip_address, port, map_size, time)[source]¶

initialize member variables

Parameters:
  • ip_address – ip-address which the client connects to (default=’localhost’)
  • port – port which the client connects to (default=5050)
  • map_size – size of the map, always square! (default=10)
  • time – time the client takes in between each turn, in seconds (default=1)
around_pos(pos)[source]¶

gets the positions around a certain field guaranteed in a [0 - map_size] interval

Parameters:pos – position of field to be searched in [y,x] list
Returns:list of fields around pos

Parameters:pos – position in [y,x] list

Parameters:path – A path of fields which are to be visited
Returns:A list of directions instead of the direct fields, helps enormously when developing the logic

With the information of the intern map create a Graph object and fill it with the information :return: a graph object filled with the nodes and edges of the intern map

get_pos_x(ch_y)[source]¶
Parameters:ch_x – x coordinate to be checked
Returns:x coordinate of player added with x coordinate of parameter guaranteed in interval [0 - map_size]

class Game.client.CommandType[source]¶

class Game.client.Graph[source]¶

Bases: object

Graph class with represent a graph object. A graph is needed in order for the dijkstra algorithm to work correctly In a graph, a node is a field, which is connected to other fields. Those connections are colled edges. In this case, each field is a tile and is connected to the other sourrounding fields via 4 edges. Adding to that, each edge has its own distance, this can be imagined as the ‘cost’ which is needed to travel along that edge. For example, a mountain is more expensive to travel to than a forest field

Src code from: https://gist.github.com/mdsrosa/c71339cb23bc51e711d8

__init__()[source]¶

Initialize the Graph object

add_edge(from_node, to_node, distance)[source]¶

Add an edge to the graph object - A ‘connection’

Parameters:
  • from_node – The node from which the edge sources from
  • to_node – The node which is targetet by the source
  • distance – How far apart those nodes are - The ‘price’ - How expensive it is
Returns:

None

Parameters:value – the node to be added
Returns:None
Game.client.dijkstra(graph, initial)[source]¶

The infamous Dijsktra algorithm

Parameters:
  • graph – graph object which represents the map in such a form that the dijkstra algorithm can process it
  • initial – The initial node from which every edge gets returned
Returns:

The path which was already visited and the actual path

Src code from https://gist.github.com/mdsrosa/c71339cb23bc51e711d8

‘Uses’ the output of the dijstkra function to get the shortets path of two points

Parameters:
  • graph – Graph object which represents the map
  • origin – From where the path sources from
  • destination – Destination of the path
Returns:

A List of how many were already visited and the actual path

generate_modules Module¶

sphinx-autopackage-script

This script parses a directory tree looking for python modules and packages and creates ReST files appropriately to create code documentation with Sphinx. It also creates a modules index (named modules.<suffix>).

Game.generate_modules.create_module_file(package, module, opts)[source]¶

Build the text of the file and write the file.

Game.generate_modules.create_modules_toc_file(master_package, modules, opts, name='modules')[source]¶

Create the module’s index.

Build the text of the file and write the file.

Game.generate_modules.format_directive(module, package=None)[source]¶

Create the automodule directive and add the options.

Game.generate_modules.format_heading(level, text)[source]¶

Create a heading of <level> [1, 2 or 3 supported].

Game.generate_modules.is_excluded(root, excludes)[source]¶

Check if the directory is in the exclude list.

Note: by having trailing slashes, we avoid common prefix issues, like
e.g. an exlude “foo” also accidentally excluding “foobar”.
Game.generate_modules.main()[source]¶

Parse and check the command line arguments.

Game.generate_modules.makename(package, module)[source]¶

Join package and module with a dot.

Game.generate_modules.normalize_excludes(rootpath, excludes)[source]¶

Normalize the excluded directory list: * must be either an absolute path or start with rootpath, * otherwise it is joined with rootpath * with trailing slash

Game.generate_modules.recurse_tree(path, excludes, opts)[source]¶

Look for every file in the directory tree and create the corresponding ReST files.

Game.generate_modules.shall_skip(module)[source]¶

Check if we want to skip this module.

Game.generate_modules.write_file(name, text, opts)[source]¶

Write the output file for module/package <name>.
